Tools¶

File_IO¶

fabry.tools.file_io.dict_2_h5(fname, dic, append=False)¶
Writes a dictionary to a hdf5 file with given filename
It will use lzf compression for all numpy arrays
Parameters:
  • fname (str) – filename to write to
  • dic (dict) – dictionary to write
  • append (bool) – if true, will append to file instead of overwriting, default=False
fabry.tools.file_io.h5_2_dict(fname)¶

Reads a dictionary from a hdf5 file with given filename

Parameters:fname (str) – hdf5 filename to read
Returns:dictionary of hdf5 keys
Return type:dict
fabry.tools.file_io.prep_folder(path)¶
Checks if folder exists and recursively creates folders
to ensure the path is valid
Parameters:path (str) – path to folder
fabry.tools.file_io.read_Ld_results(Ld_directory)¶

Reads L and d histogram data from multinest run

Parameters:Ld_directory (str) – path to multinest save directory
Returns:Tuple (np.ndarray, np.ndarray) L histogram values (in pixels), d histogram values (in mm)
fabry.tools.file_io.recursive_load_dict_from_h5(h5, path)¶

function used in load_h5_to_dict in order to get recursion

fabry.tools.file_io.recursive_save_dict_to_h5(h5, path, dic)¶

function used in save_dict_to_h5 in order to get recursion

Images¶

fabry.tools.images.get_data(filename, color=None)¶

Reads image data from filename

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – filename to read
  • color (Union[int, str]) – [0,2] for rgb, or a letter from rgb
Returns:

2d image data
Return type:

np.ndarray
fabry.tools.images.get_metadata(filename)¶

Returns metadata from image filename

Parameters:filename (str) – file to get metadata from
Returns:dictionary containing metadata
Return type:dict
fabry.tools.images.register_reader(reader_func)¶

Decorator for registering functions as image readers

Parameters:reader_func (collections.Callable) – callable function for reading in image files

Plotting¶

class fabry.tools.plotting.ClickBuilder(fig)¶

Little class for interactive plot features

x¶

list – x values from clicking

y¶

list – y values from clicking

fig¶

matplotlib.figure.Figure – matplotlib figure to get clicks from

cid¶

int – id for the matplotlib callback

onclick(event)¶

Callback function for registering matplotlib clicks. X and Y values are stored in self.x and self.y

Parameters:event (matplotlib.backend_bases.LocationEvent) – matplotlib location event
fabry.tools.plotting.center_plot(data, x0=None, y0=None)¶

Runs clickable center plot for an image

Parameters:
  • data (np.ndarray) – pixel values for image
  • x0 (float, default=None) – x center for zoomed image, if none will use the center of data array
  • y0 (float, default=None) – y center for zoomed image, if none will use the cneter of data array
Returns:

x value of click guess, y value of click guess
Return type:

Tuple (float, float)
fabry.tools.plotting.my_hist(ax, data, bins=None, horizontal=False)¶

Custom histogram function for plotting multinest output

Parameters:
  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – axes to plot with
  • data (np.ndarray) – array of values to histogram
  • bins (int, optional) – number of bins in histogram
  • horizontal (bool) – histogram is horizontal if True
Returns:

bin edges for the histogram
Return type:

np.ndarray
fabry.tools.plotting.my_hist2d(ax, data1, data2, bins=None, z=30)¶

Custom 2d histrogram option for plotting correlations

Parameters:
  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – axes to plot with
  • data1 (np.ndarray) – array of values to histogram
  • data2 (np.ndarray) – other array of values
  • bins (int, optional) – number of bins in histogram
  • z (int) – number of filled contours
Returns:

colorbar from the 2d histogram
Return type:

matplotlib.colorbar.Colorbar
fabry.tools.plotting.peak_plot(r, sig, peaks, peaks_sd, orders, fax=None, anspks=None, anspks_sd=None)¶

Plots ringsum data with labeled peaks and orders

Parameters:
  • r (np.ndarray) – r array from ringsum
  • sig (np.ndarray) – ringsum signal
  • peaks (dict) – dictionary of peak locations the keys are the wavelengths
  • peaks_sd (dict) – dictionary of peak errors
  • orders (dict) – dictionary of peak orders the keys are the wavelengths
  • fax (tuple, default=None) – the figure and axis handles for the plot, if adding to existing plot. Default is None, which will make a new set of figure and axes and run plt.show()
  • anspks (dict) – dictionary with peak answers from multinest
  • anspks_sd (dict) – dictionary with peak sd answers from multinest
fabry.tools.plotting.ring_plot(data, fax=None, block=True)¶

Plots the Fabry Perot ring image

Parameters:
  • data (np.ndarray) – 2D image data
  • fax (tuple, optional) – figure and axis
  • block (bool) – True if you want plt.show(block=True)
fabry.tools.plotting.ringsum_click(r, sig, title='Click Me!')¶

Runs clickable ringsum plot

Parameters:
  • r (np.ndarray) – bin values
  • sig (np.ndarray) – ringsum values
  • title (str) – instructions for clicker displayed as plot title
Returns:

x value(s) of click(s), y value(s) of click(s)
Return type:

Tuple (list, list)
fabry.tools.plotting.tableau20_colors()¶

Good set of colors for plotting

Returns:list of r,g,b color values
Return type:list
